Posts.Content: Today is Day 7 (Fec-T started on Monday 24th.  I have followed instructions and meds etc with only slight nausea first thing in the morning.  However, I have one question.  I have read of women who have their chemo then go to work, shopping etc.  Am I being a softy?  I am absolutely knocked out, although eating well, but could sleep all day and night if I didnt force myself to do stuff in the house. Again, not ill just really tired.  Any comments would be welcome.  I am quite happy if that is normal, dozing is nice lol
Posts.Title: Day 7 Am I a softy?

Posts.Content: Thanks Anne Marie.  I feel much better now.  I will now relax for the next two weeks until the next ttreatment.  Love dozing anyway x
Posts.Title: Day 7 Am I a softy?

Posts.Content: Thanks all,  All I can say is that I am so looking forward to the third week of each session.

Posts.Content: How right you all were!  Today is week three and I have been feeling good since Saturday.  No dozing, done some gardening (wearing double gloves and loads of cover up clothes haha)  It means I can get stuff done in preparation for my dozy two weeks which will start after my second fec on 15th!

Posts.Content: Just had a phone call from my line manager telling me that I go on to half pay on 7th June for 150 days.  Although I have not been told officially I am wondering what I should do.  I have my appointment with the Onchologist  coincidentally on 7th June then chemo should start soon after that.  Following that I have radiotherapy.   Obviously I cannot not have the treatments but as a single person, I am not sure how I pay all the bills.  Any advice as to who or where I can get some advice?  Thanks
